definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: Actress Go Ara's mature body is attracting hot attention.
sentences.chinese: 演员高雅拉的成熟身体吸引了大家热潮的注意。

sentences.english: World Cup fever and Neymarmania have literally gone to some Brazilians' heads.
sentences.chinese: 世界杯热潮和内马尔热都跑到巴西人的脑袋上了。

sentences.english: China has long been led by exports and investment-driven economic boom has cooled.
sentences.chinese: 中国长期以来由出口和投资拉动的经济热潮已经降温。

sentences.english: As happened in that boom, most of these ideas will come to naught.
sentences.chinese: 就像那次热潮一样，这些思想大都一事无成。

sentences.english: These days the fever of learning English as young as possible has swept all over China.
sentences.chinese: 如今英语学习低龄化的热潮已经席卷中国。

sentences.english: The shelves in the supermarket is full of items before the Christmas rush.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞争购热潮前超市市场的货架堆满了商品。

sentences.english: Tourism officials call it the “Hokkaido boom”.
sentences.chinese: 旅游局的官员称这种现象为“北海道热潮”。

sentences.english: Last year, Star Wars: The Phantom Menace was big. This year it's more mixed.
sentences.chinese: 去年是《星战前传》的热潮，今年则是百花齐放。

sentences.english: Spring has begun, and so has Japan's obsession with cherry blossoms。
sentences.chinese: 春天来了，日本各地的赏樱热潮也开始了。

sentences.english: As internet mimes go this one is definitely the cat's whiskers.
sentences.chinese: 要说最新的网络模仿热潮，绝对非猫咪胡须照莫属。

sentences.english: This is a look at the rise of foot-powered travel in America.
sentences.chinese: 看一看美国‘动脚’热潮的兴起吧。

sentences.english: The crazes for high salaries are still the driving force.
sentences.chinese: 而追求高薪水也依然热潮的原动力。

sentences.english: The expansion of Bangkok's Skytrain network is fueling the city's real estate boom.
sentences.chinese: 曼谷城铁网络的扩展为房地产热潮增添动力。

sentences.english: Because of the advertising boom, people are used to seeing high standards of visual design.
sentences.chinese: 由于广告的热潮，人们看惯了高标准的视觉设计。

sentences.english: The wireless communication revolution has spawned a revival of interest in the design and optimization of radio transceivers.
sentences.chinese: 无线通信的迅猛发展激发了射频收发器设计的热潮。

sentences.english: The hottest items are chunky heels with buckles.
sentences.chinese: 最热潮品是带装饰扣的方跟鞋。

definition: tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
to lift/to raise in height/to begin/upsurge/to set off (a campaign)
to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
